bibl.title: Demarco v. McKay. Petition Attorney Statement
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In District Court Second Judicial District, holding Terms at Tacoma, in and for Pierce County, Washington territory
In the Matter of the Petition of Frank Demarco for a writ of Habeas Corpus against H.F. McKay}
Territory of Washington County of Pierce} ss

Ira A. Town being first duly sworn in oath says, that he is one of the Attorneys of the Petition in the above entitled matter, that the writ herein was duly issued out of this Circut on March 5, 1887 and served on that day upon H.F. McKay the respondent herein, and that said H.F. McKay did on said day make oral return in said writ and being the body of said petitioner before this court in said 5th day of March 1887, and that the prosecuting attorney of the district, over the district of Pierce County has duly notified of the time of of said
